alert.note: Alert for Garfield; Wheeler (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 29 at 5:33PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Garfield and southern Wheeler Counties through 615 PM CDT... At 532 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles north of Fort Hartsuff State Park, or 8 miles northeast of Burwell, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Burwell, Bartlett, Ericson, Deverre, Pibel Lake State Recreation Area and Gables. This includes Highway 281 between mile markers 132 and 146. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
